title: ELECTRO QUIZZERS
subtitle: TECHNICAL
description:
About the event:

The quiz consists of some basic engineering questions related to technical stuff. If you think you can excel in this test, try it out and check your knowledge.Students learn by connecting new knowledge with concepts they already know, most effectively in active social classrooms where they negotiate understanding through interaction.

Rules And Regulations:
Maximum team size: 3 members.
Quiz will be based on electrical and electronics engineering.
There will be 3 rounds.
Teams not meeting cutoff marks will be eliminated.
In case of a tie, a sudden death question will determine the qualifier.
Round 1: Visual round (questions displayed on screen).
Round 2: General and logical technical questions.
Round 3: Buzzer round.
Team with maximum points after Round 3 wins.
Judges’ decision is final.
Internet use is strictly prohibited, violation results in disqualification.

Registration Fee:
Rs 200/ per team

Prize Worth:
1st Position: Rs 1500/
2nd Position: Rs 1100/
Participation certificates for all participants.

Event Coordinators:
Saksham Saraf : 91 98765 43210

Individual participant event.
Participants must use AutoCAD 2010.
Use of electronic devices/accessories is prohibited.

'JECRC Blink It' is a technical event where teams present unique business ideas. The event consists of two rounds: in the first, teams present their ideas and answer judges' questions. The top 1/3rd teams advance to the final round, where they discuss marketing strategies and target customers.

Rules And Regulations:
Team size: 3 members.
Internet use is prohibited.
Each team gets 3 minutes in Round 1 to present their idea.
Only 1/3rd of teams advance to the final round.
The best business idea and marketing strategy wins.
No projectors or presenting devices are provided—verbal explanation only.
7. Exceeding the time limit results in disqualification.
8. Phone use is prohibited.
9. Judging criteria: uniqueness and potential of the idea.
10. Final decision rests with the adjudicators.

title: DEXTERITY  BRIDGEOMANIA
subtitle: TECHNICAL
description:
About the event:
A structural engineering competition where participants build a bridge using Popsicle sticks. The bridge must be structurally sound and meet given specifications.

Rules And Regulations:
 Maximum team size: 3 members.
 Members from different institutions can form a team.
 Adhesive and 200 Popsicle sticks will be provided.
 Using any other materials is not permitted.
 Dimensions: Length (span)  50 cm, Clearance  5 cm on each side, Width  10 cm (error margin: 2 cm width, 4 cm length).
 If the bridge does not meet constraints, it will be rejected.
 The bridge supporting the maximum weight at the center wins.
 Efficiency Ratio: Load taken / weight of the bridge.

Registration Fee:
INR 350 per team.

Prize Worth:

description:

A Mechanical Engineering knowledgebased competition with multiple exciting rounds.

Rules And Regulations:

 Top 8 teams qualify for the Final Round.

Round 2:
 Stage I: Rapid Fire (15 seconds per question, pass allowed, 1 for incorrect answer).
 Stage II: Tech Dumb Charades (Identify objects using gestures, 2 points per correct answer).
 Stage III: Buzzer Round (10 questions, fastest to buzz gets to answer, 1 for incorrect answer).
 In case of a tie, an extra 5 questions will determine the final winner.

Final results are based on combined scores from Rounds 2 and 3.

title: FORMULA ZERO
subtitle: TECHNICAL
description:
About the event:
Formula Zero is a robotics competition where participants build and control robots to complete an obstaclefilled track in minimum time. The event tests design, speed, and maneuvering skills.

Rules And Regulations:
 Team Size: Maximum 3 members.
 The bot can be wired or wireless. Wireless bots must use a dualfrequency remote.
 Participants must use a nonpolluting electric power supply (voltage must not exceed 12V DC).
 The bot must start from the START line and cross checkpoints in a given order.
 At least 5 checkpoints will have specific obstacles (pebbles, sand, water, spikes, soil, nails, etc.).
 Maximum of 2 skips allowed; failing will result in disqualification.
 Points of skipped checkpoints will not be counted.
 The event is timebased; the timer starts at the START point and stops when reaching the FINISH point.
 Timer will not stop during the skipping process.
 The team with the highest score (points minus penalty plus time left) wins.

Scoring:
 Points awarded for each crossed checkpoint.
 In case of a skip, penalty time will be added.
 Final score = Total points  Penalty + Seconds left from 480 seconds (only if the bot reaches the FINISH line).

Certification Policy:
 Top three teams will be awarded prizes.
 Participation certificates for all participants.

Registration Fee: Rs 600/ per team.

Prize Worth: Rs 25,000/

Event Coordinators:
Saksham Saraf : 91 98765 43210

title: ROBO SOCCER
subtitle: TECHNICAL
description:
About the event:
RoboSoccer is an exciting robotics event where teams build remotecontrolled robots to play soccer. The aim is to push the ball into the opponent’s goal using various mechanisms.

Rules And Regulations:
 Event Structure:
   Preliminary Stage: Teams push as many balls as possible into the opponent’s goal.
   Knockout Stage: A soccerstyle match where the team scoring the most goals wins.
 Team Size: Maximum 3 members.
 The bot must fit within 30cm x 30cm x 30cm and weigh no more than 5 kg.
 Maximum voltage: 24V DC.
 The robot can be controlled via wired or wireless remote. Wireless bots must use dualfrequency remotes.
 No external assistance allowed once the match starts.
 The team that scores the maximum goals within 6 minutes (3minute halves + 1minute break) wins.
 In case of a tie, an additional 1minute round will be played.
 If a tie persists, judges will decide the winner based on performance.

Certification Policy:
 Top three teams will receive prizes.
 Participation certificates for all participants.

Registration Fee: Rs 600/ per team.

Prize Worth: Rs 25,000/

Event Coordinators:
Saksham Saraf : 91 98765 43210

title: GAME OF DRONES
subtitle: TECHNICAL
description:
About the event:
Participants design and fly a wireless remotecontrolled drone to complete an obstacle course in the shortest time possible.

Rules And Regulations:
 Team size: Maximum 3 members.
 Machines cannot be interchanged between teams.
 Each drone must be registered separately.
 Maximum competition time: 7 minutes per team.
 A timeout of 3 minutes is allowed.
 The type of drone cannot be changed after the competition starts.
 Teams will be scored based on obstacle navigation, and the highestscoring team wins.
 Drones causing deliberate interference or damage will be disqualified.

Model Specifications:
 Maximum dimensions: 600mm x 600mm x 600mm (±5% tolerance allowed).
 Position hold features are NOT allowed.

Certification Policy:
 Top three teams will receive prizes.
 Participation certificates will be provided.

Registration Fee: Rs 1200/ per team.

title: ROBO WAR
subtitle: TECHNICAL
description:
About the event:
RoboWar is a thrilling combat robotics event where participants design and build battleready robots to compete in a knockoutstyle tournament.

Rules And Regulations:
 Competition Format: Knockout battles.
 Match duration: Maximum 2 minutes.
 If a bot remains immobile for 30 seconds, it will be disqualified.
 Power Supply: Only DC power allowed, max voltage 36V.
 Maximum bot weight: 30 kg.
 Machine size: Maximum 750mm x 750mm x 1000mm.
 No readymade machine bases allowed.
 Arena: 20x20 feet total, with a 17x17 feet playing area and a 3x3 feet knockout zone.
 Robots must have proper mobility mechanisms (rolling, walking, shuffling allowed; jumping/hopping/flying not allowed).
 Bots must have a safety cover on sharp edges.
 All robots must pass safety inspections before competing.
 If a fight is halted, organizers have the right to intervene and restart.
 Unsafe or harmful designs will be disqualified immediately.
 Qualification for the next level is at the judges’ discretion.

Certification Policy:
 Top three teams will be awarded prizes.
 Participation certificates for all participants.

Registration Fee: Rs 1200/ per team.

Prize Worth: Rs 59,000/

title: SAREGA (SOLO SINGING)
subtitle: CULTURAL
description:
About the Event:
What makes your day complete? What is the one thing which is loved by allof us? MUSIC! Let's celebrate the power of voice, talent, and individualexpression. Grab the opportunity and showcase your singing talent with“SAREGA”.
 
Rules and Regulations:
Only one entry is allowed per participant.
Open entries are allowed.
Rap portions or refrains are not permissible.
Participants will not be allowed to refer to the lyrics while singing.
Choice of song is open to the participants.
The song should not have any slangs or derogatory language.
Participants can perform in Hindi, Punjabi, or English.

Participants can perform with Karaoke track (only in the stage round).

title: MASTERCHEF (COOKING COMPETITION)

description:
About the Event:

Rules and Regulations:

Organizers will only provide one induction per team for Food on Fire.
No prior preparation of any type will be allowed in any case.

title: GULLY CRICKET
subtitle: SPLASH
description:
About the Event:

Gully Cricket is a term used to describe backyard cricket. It is a game that can be played anywhere and everywhere: in a parking lot or at an empty street. You can even play it in the corridor of your house.

Rules and Regulations:

Batting Rules:
HIT OVER THE BOUNDARY  It is not six: If the batsman hits direct over the boundary, he is out. However, if the ball crosses the boundary line grounded, it is a four.
NO GOLDEN DUCKS  A player cannot be given out on his first ball, i.e.,the very first ball played by the batsman is a free hit.

Fielding Rules:
ONE TIP ONE HAND OUT  No juggling is permitted. The 'tip catch' with one hand must be clean; it is not out if you use your other hand to support the hand taking the tip catch. If you nick it onto your body, that will count as a tip/bounce, and you would have to be caught with one hand to be out.

IMPORTANT:
In fielding, unlike boys, the girls can catch the ball with 2 hands on 1 tip and it’s out. Negative marking for exceeding the time limit.

Bowling Rules:
Bowling Style  Under Arm: The ball being delivered with the hand below the waist, else any other bowling style would be considered as a no ball.
Every dead ball is a no ball.
Only 1 bowler can bowl a maximum of 2 overs.
On every no ball, the next ball is awarded as a free hit to the batsman.

BONANZA FOR GIRLS:
OVER ARM  Unlike boys, girls can deliver the ball from the hand above shoulder height.
Even if she hits the ball directly over the boundary, it is not an out but a 6.
1 TIP 2 HANDS OUT  Even if she catches the ball with 2 hands on first tip, the batsman gets out.
HALF THE RUNS  The batsman only gets 50% of runs scored in her over.

Registration Amount:
Registration fee  Rs 150/ per participant.

Prize:
1st Position  Rs 2500/
2nd Position  Rs 1500/
Participation certificates will be given to all participants.

title: ARM WRESTLING
subtitle: SPLASH
description:
About the Event:

An Arm Wrestling event is a thrilling competition where participants showcase their strength, technique, and endurance in a oneonone contest. Competitors engage in a test of power and strategy, with their arms locked on a table, trying to pin their opponent's hand to the surface.

Rules and Regulations:
Starting Position: Both competitors must start with their elbows on the table and their hands gripping each other’s, with the wrist joint properly aligned.
Grip: The referee sets the initial grip, ensuring both hands are in the proper position before the match begins.
Elbow Placement: Elbows must remain on the table. If a competitor's elbow lifts, it's considered a foul.
Referee’s Command: The match begins only after the referee calls "Go" or gives the signal to start.
Winning: A competitor wins by pinning the opponent’s hand to the table or forcing their arm beyond a certain range (usually 90 degrees).
Fouls: A foul can occur if a competitor leaves the starting position, twists the wrist too aggressively, or uses illegal grips.
Best of Three: Some events may use a "best of three" format to determine the winner.
Safety: Protecting joints and avoiding excessive force is critical; any signs of injury will halt the match for evaluation.

Disclaimer: The event organizers, staff, and sponsors are not liable for any injuries, accidents, or damages that may occur during or as a result of the competition. Participants must follow all safety guidelines and instructions provided by referees and event organizers.

Registration Amount:

Participation certificates will be given to all participants.

description:
About the Event:

Treasure Hunt is a thrilling game where participants embark on a quest to discover hidden treasures scattered across various locations. Armed with clues and riddles, players must navigate through challenges, solving puzzles, and unraveling mysteries to uncover the coveted treasures within a specified timeframe.

Rules and Regulations:
All teams must have at least 5 members and not more than 6.
Teams must stay together during the Treasure Hunt and are encouraged to work together to solve the clues and retrieve new clues from each location.
Each team in the hunt is assigned a number. A paper with this number on it is provided at signin on the day of the hunt.
The team that arrives first at the final destination with all the treasures will be considered the winner.
Disqualification will result from any of the following:
Damaging any property.
Interfering with other teams or their members in any way.
Copying from other teams.
Stealing from other teams.

Registration Amount:
Registration fee  Rs 150/ per participant.

Prize:
Winner  Rs 2000/
Runnerup  Rs 1000/
Participation certificates will be given to all participants.

title: HALF COURT BASKETBALL(3V3)
subtitle: SPLASH
description:
About the Event:

3x3 basketball is a variation of basketball played threeaside, with one backboard and in a halfcourt setup.

Rules and Regulations:
Team Roster: 4 players (3 Boys & 1 Girl), 3+1 substitute.
The substitute can enter the game after his teammate steps off the court behind the end line opposite the basket.
The girl player must play at least 1 quarter.
Game duration: 2 x 15 minutes.
Free throw(s) following a shooting foul: 1 free throw, 2 free throws if the foul is committed behind the arc.
Foul limit per team: 6 team fouls.
Penalty for team fouls 7, 8 & 9: 2 free throws.
In dead ball situations, prior to the check ball.
Timeout in a quarter for each team.

Registration Amount:
Registration fee  Rs 150/ per participant.

Prize:
Winner  Rs 2500/
Runnerup  Rs 1500/
Participation certificates will be given to all participants.

title: SAC RACE
subtitle: SPLASH
description:
About the Event:

Participants hop and race with enthusiasm, their legs bound in sacks, creating a playful spectacle at the sack race event. Laughter echoes as they navigate the course, showcasing agility and teamwork in this lighthearted and entertaining competition.

Rules and Regulations:
Each player needs a burlap sack.
Players should put both feet in the sack.
Players must keep both feet in the sack and at least one hand on the sack at all times.
The sack must remain as close to the waist as possible and cannot fall below the knees.
Players should hop as fast as they can to the finish line.
The first competitor to reach the finish line is the winner.
Players can run in the sacks, but it is recommended that they hop and run towards the finishing line.
All participants are required to stay within their lanes to avoid disqualification.

Registration Amount:
Registration fee  Rs 150/ per participant.

Prize:
Winner  Rs 1500/
Runnerup  Rs 1000/
Participation certificates will be given to all participants.

title: CHESS
subtitle: SPLASH
description:
About the Event:

Sharpen your mind and challenge your friends in a thrilling online Chess tournament. Compete in a fun and friendly atmosphere, suitable for players of all skill levels. Win exciting prizes and bragging rights as the ultimate Chess champion.

Rules and Regulations:
The game will be played on Chess.com.
Everyone should have the app on their phones.
There will be matches of 10 minutes and 5 minutes.
Each player will get 2 chances to play.
After each corresponding game, the participants who win will move ahead.
Familiarize yourself with Chess.com's features and functionality.
Follow Chess.com's terms of service and community guidelines.
Participants must play the game without any external assistance.

Registration Amount:
Registration fee  Rs 150/ per participant.

Prize:
Overall  Rs 1000/
Participation certificates will be given to all participants.

title: TUG OF WAR
subtitle: SPLASH
description:
About the Event:

Tug of war is a competitive team sport in which two teams pull on opposite ends of a rope, trying to drag the other team across a designated line. It tests strength, teamwork, and strategy. The game has ancient origins and is played in various forms worldwide, including in competitions and festivals.

Rules and Regulations:
A strong rope with a center marking is used, along with two side markers to indicate the winning point.
Teams stand at opposite ends of the rope with the center mark aligned with a designated line.
Players must hold the rope without wrapping it around their arms or hands.
The goal is to pull the opposing team past the marked line towards their side.
The game starts on the referee’s whistle or signal.
Using unfair means, sudden jerks, or stepping out of the designated area results in a foul.
Players are not allowed to sit or kneel while pulling the rope.
A team wins when they successfully pull the opposing team past the designated mark.
A team will have 9 participants (8 Boys + 1 Girl).

Registration Amount:
Registration fee  Rs 150/ per participant.

Prize:
Overall  Rs 2000/
Participation certificates will be given to all participants.

Disclaimer:
The organizing team/institute will not be responsible for any injuries that happen during the game.

title: 3 LEG RACE
subtitle: SPLASH
description:
About the Event:

The threelegged race is a fun outdoor game that requires teamwork and coordination. In this race, two participants stand side by side and tie one of their adjacent legs together, effectively creating 'three legs' between them. They must then run or walk towards the finish line while maintaining balance and synchronization.

Rules and Regulations:
The race is played in pairs, with two participants forming a team.
One leg of each participant (the adjacent legs) must be securely tied together with a cloth or band.
The race begins only after the official signal or whistle.
Teams cannot untie their legs during the race; doing so leads to disqualification.
Pushing, pulling, or interfering with other teams is not allowed.
The first team to cross the finish line without breaking the rules wins.
In some events, the race may have multiple rounds to determine the ultimate winner.

Registration Amount:
Registration fee  Rs 150/ per participant.

Prize:
Overall  Rs 2000/
Participation certificates will be given to all participants.

Disclaimer:
The event organizers, staff, and sponsors are not liable for any injuries, accidents, or damages that may occur during or as a result of the competition. Participants must follow all safety guidelines and instructions provided by referees and event organizers.
